unnormalised: **Automotive News: Decoding the Latest Vehicle Launches**
normalised: **Automotive News: Decoding the Latest Vehicle Launches**

unnormalised: This week saw a flurry of activity in the Indian automotive sector, with manufacturers vying for the attention of Diwali shoppers. Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam Automotive Research Institute presented a white paper detailing the increasing focus on fuel efficiency across new launches.
normalised: This week saw a flurry of activity in the Indian automotive sector, with manufacturers vying for the attention of Diwali shoppers. Doctor A P J Abdul Kalam Automotive Research Institute presented a white paper detailing the increasing focus on fuel efficiency across new launches.

unnormalised: Mahindra unveiled its much-anticipated "Scorpio-N EV," promising a range of 450 km on a single charge and featuring connected car tech developed in partnership with IIT Madras. The base model is expected to be priced around Rs. 25 Lakhs.
normalised: Mahindra unveiled its much-anticipated "Scorpio-N E V," promising a range of four hundred and fifty kilometer on a single charge and featuring connected car tech developed in partnership with I I T Madras. The base model is expected to be priced around rupee twenty five lakhs.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Maruti Suzuki launched a CNG variant of its popular "Brezza" compact SUV, targeting budget-conscious buyers in Tier-2 cities. The Brezza CNG boasts a fuel efficiency of 35 km/kg.
normalised: Meanwhile, Maruti Suzuki launched a C N G variant of its popular "Brezza" compact S U V, targeting budget-conscious buyers in Tier-two cities. The Brezza C N G boasts a fuel efficiency of thirty five kilometer per kilogram.

unnormalised: Tata Motors showcased its new "Avinya" concept electric vehicle, highlighting its spacious interior designed with sustainable materials. The Avinya's design emphasizes maximizing cabin space, offering legroom comparable to cars with a larger footprint, occupying roughly 250 sq ft. Industry experts predict a significant shift towards electric vehicles in the coming year, driven by government incentives and growing consumer awareness.
normalised: Tata Motors showcased its new "Avinya" concept electric vehicle, highlighting its spacious interior designed with sustainable materials. The Avinya's design emphasizes maximizing cabin space, offering legroom comparable to cars with a larger footprint, occupying roughly two hundred and fifty square feet. Industry experts predict a significant shift towards electric vehicles in the coming year, driven by government incentives and growing consumer awareness.
